intro: Cynoctonum fimbriatum, commonly known as the fringed balsa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its unique foliage and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
